pageContext.claim: “Texas [is] producing 30 percent more natural gas and 60 percent more oil.”
pageContext.analysis: Natural gas production increased 9 percent in Texas year over year from 2017 to 2018, according to the U.S. Energy Information Administration. 2019 data is not yet available. Natural gas production in October 2019 was 35 percent higher and oil production was 58 percent higher than in February 2017, but that does not directly correlate to an overall 35 percent (or 60 percent) increase, as months can vary dramatically in production.
